title: Authors and Citation
text: Sydney Bell. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Bell S (2022). gaugerr: Analyzes Gauge Repeatability Reproducibility Data. R package version 0.6.0, https://aloy.github.io/gaugerr/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {gaugerr: Analyzes Gauge Repeatability and Reproducibility Data},   author = {Sydney Bell},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.6.0},   url = {https://aloy.github.io/gaugerr/}, }

title: Analyzes Gauge Repeatability and Reproducibility Data
text: gaugerr package uses common models implement Gauge R&R analysis. package developed tidymodels framework. user provides data analysis choses function determine type input desired.

title: Analyzes Gauge Repeatability and Reproducibility Data
text: can install development version gaugerr using code :
code: install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("aloy/gaugerr")

title: Analyzes Gauge Repeatability and Reproducibility Data
text: several ways use package different functions depending calculations interest. One highlight function package gauge_rr(). data set specific parameters (part, operator, measurement, interaction, factor1 factor2) passed function, decides type analysis needed given information. table gives information point estimator quantity upper lower bounds confidence intervals. function always return object columns object can plotted show values visually. figure plots information table values. points values point estimators line segments show range upper lower bounds confidence interval.

title: Analyzes Gauge Repeatability and Reproducibility Data
text: package intended user friendly individuals wanting run Gauge R&R analysis. specific functions particular calculations interest general functions provide overview.

title: Balanced Without Interaction — balanced_no_interaction
text: Balanced Without Interaction

title: Balanced Without Interaction — balanced_no_interaction
code: balanced_no_interaction(   data,   part = P,   operator = O,   measurement = Y,   alpha = 0.05,   conf_type = "mls" )

title: Balanced Without Interaction — balanced_no_interaction
text: data data frame contains measurements, operators parts Gauge R&R analysis part column data frame part labels measurements operator column data frame operator labels measurements measurement column data frame measurements object collected alpha value confidence interval calculation (.e. 95% CI alpha=0.05) conf_type parameter specifies confidence interval type desired function two options ("mls" "gpq")

title: Balanced Without Interaction — balanced_no_interaction
text: data frame values point estimates upper lower bounds estimate

title: Balanced With Interaction Analysis — balanced_with_interaction
text: Balanced Interaction Analysis

title: Balanced With Interaction Analysis — balanced_with_interaction
code: balanced_with_interaction(   data,   part = P,   operator = O,   measurement = Y,   alpha = 0.05,   conf_type = "mls" )

title: Balanced With Interaction Analysis — balanced_with_interaction
text: data data frame contains measurements, operators parts Gauge R&R analysis part column data frame part labels measurements operator column data frame operator labels measurements measurement column data frame measurements object collected alpha value confidence interval calculation (.e. 95% CI alpha=0.05) conf_type specifying type confidence interval wanted calculation, two options ("mls" "gpq")

title: Balanced With Interaction Analysis — balanced_with_interaction
text: returns data frame confidence intervals data passed function

title: Balanced With Interaction Analysis — balanced_with_interaction
code: mydata <- data.frame(P=c(1,1,1,2,2,2), O=c(1,2,3,1,2,3), Y=c(2,2.1,2.2,1.9,2.3,1.8)) balanced_with_interaction(mydata, part=P, operator=O, measurement=Y, alpha=0.01) #> Warning: NaNs produced #> Warning: NaNs produced #> Warning: NaNs produced #> Warning: NaNs produced #> Warning: NaNs produced #> Warning: NaNs produced #> Warning: NaNs produced #> Warning: NaNs produced #>                     quantity estimate     lower      upper #> 1                     repeat      NaN       NaN        NaN #> 2                       part        0 -2.975566 127.309752 #> 3                   operator        0 -4.460442   3.466303 #> 4  part operator interaction      NaN       NaN        NaN #> 5                      total      NaN       NaN        NaN #> 6                   s2_repro      NaN       NaN        NaN #> 7                      gauge      NaN       NaN        NaN #> 8                   pg_ratio      NaN       NaN        NaN #> 9                   tg_ratio      NaN       NaN        NaN #> 10                  pr_ratio      NaN       NaN        NaN balanced_with_interaction(mydata, conf_type = "gpq") #> Warning: NaNs produced #> Warning: NaNs produced #>     quantity estimate lower     upper #> 1  s2_repeat      NaN    NA        NA #> 2       s2_p        0     0 5.2199088 #> 3       s2_o        0     0 0.6042627 #> 4      s2_po      NaN    NA        NA #> 5     s2_tot      NaN    NA        NA #> 6   s2_repro      NaN    NA        NA #> 7   s2_gauge      NaN    NA        NA #> 8   pg_ratio      NaN    NA        NA #> 9   gt_ratio      NaN    NA        NA #> 10  pr_ratio      NaN    NA        NA

code: conf_intervals(data, part = P, operator = O, measurement = Y, alpha = 0.05)

title: Modified large-sample (MLS) Confidence Interval Calculation — conf_intervals
text: data data frame contains measurements, operators parts Gauge R&R analysis part column data frame part labels measurements operator column data frame operator labels measurements measurement column data frame measurements object collected alpha value confidence interval calculation (.e. 95% CI alpha=0.05)

title: Modified large-sample (MLS) Confidence Interval Calculation — conf_intervals
text: data frame values point estimate upper lower bounds mls confidence interval.

title: Modified large-sample (MLS) Confidence Interval Calculation — conf_intervals
code: mydata <- data.frame(P=c(1,1,2,2,3,3),O=c(1,2,1,2,1,2),Y=c(5.3, 6.5, 5.4, 6.4, 6.9, 5.8)) conf_intervals(mydata, alpha=0.1) #> Warning: NaNs produced #> Warning: NaNs produced #> Warning: NaNs produced #> Warning: NaNs produced #> Warning: NaNs produced #> Warning: NaNs produced #> Warning: NaNs produced #> Warning: NaNs produced #>                     quantity estimate     lower      upper #> 1                     repeat      NaN       NaN        NaN #> 2                       part        0 -7.700066  0.9692434 #> 3                   operator        0 -5.121153 16.9122451 #> 4  part operator interaction      NaN       NaN        NaN #> 5                      total      NaN       NaN        NaN #> 6                   s2_repro      NaN       NaN        NaN #> 7                      gauge      NaN       NaN        NaN #> 8                   pg_ratio      NaN       NaN        NaN #> 9                   tg_ratio      NaN       NaN        NaN #> 10                  pr_ratio      NaN       NaN        NaN conf_intervals(mydata, part=P, operator=O, measurement=Y, alpha=0.01) #> Warning: NaNs produced #> Warning: NaNs produced #> Warning: NaNs produced #> Warning: NaNs produced #> Warning: NaNs produced #> Warning: NaNs produced #> Warning: NaNs produced #> Warning: NaNs produced #>                     quantity estimate     lower      upper #> 1                     repeat      NaN       NaN        NaN #> 2                       part        0 -82.77218   11.03128 #> 3                   operator        0 -55.16798 1711.57052 #> 4  part operator interaction      NaN       NaN        NaN #> 5                      total      NaN       NaN        NaN #> 6                   s2_repro      NaN       NaN        NaN #> 7                      gauge      NaN       NaN        NaN #> 8                   pg_ratio      NaN       NaN        NaN #> 9                   tg_ratio      NaN       NaN        NaN #> 10                  pr_ratio      NaN       NaN        NaN

title: Generalized Pivotal Quantities (GPQ) Confidence Intervals — conf_intervals_gpq
text: Generalized Pivotal Quantities (GPQ) Confidence Intervals

title: Generalized Pivotal Quantities (GPQ) Confidence Intervals — conf_intervals_gpq

title: Generalized Pivotal Quantities (GPQ) Confidence Intervals — conf_intervals_gpq
text: data data frame contains measurements, operators parts Gauge R&R analysis part column data frame part labels measurements operator column data frame operator labels measurements measurement column data frame measurements object collected alpha value confidence interval calculation (.e. 95% CI alpha=0.05) N number simulations run CI calculation.

title: Generalized Pivotal Quantities (GPQ) Confidence Intervals — conf_intervals_gpq
text: data frame value estimate upper lower bounds CI.

title: Generalized Pivotal Quantities (GPQ) Confidence Intervals — conf_intervals_gpq
code: mydata <- data.frame(P=c(2,2,4,4,5,5),O=c(4,4,4,4,4,4),Y=c(5.3, 6.5, 5.4, 6.4, 6.9, 5.8)) conf_intervals_gpq(mydata, alpha = 0.1) #>     quantity  estimate     lower    upper #> 1  s2_repeat 0.6083333 0.2339183 5.157737 #> 2       s2_p 0.0000000        NA       NA #> 3       s2_o       NaN        NA       NA #> 4      s2_po       Inf        NA       NA #> 5     s2_tot       NaN        NA       NA #> 6   s2_repro       NaN        NA       NA #> 7   s2_gauge       NaN        NA       NA #> 8   pg_ratio       NaN        NA       NA #> 9   gt_ratio       NaN        NA       NA #> 10  pr_ratio 0.0000000        NA       NA conf_intervals_gpq(mydata, N=1000) #>     quantity  estimate     lower    upper #> 1  s2_repeat 0.6083333 0.2031638 9.854758 #> 2       s2_p 0.0000000        NA       NA #> 3       s2_o       NaN        NA       NA #> 4      s2_po       Inf        NA       NA #> 5     s2_tot       NaN        NA       NA #> 6   s2_repro       NaN        NA       NA #> 7   s2_gauge       NaN        NA       NA #> 8   pg_ratio       NaN        NA       NA #> 9   gt_ratio       NaN        NA       NA #> 10  pr_ratio 0.0000000        NA       NA conf_intervals_gpq(mydata, part=P, operator=O, measurement=Y, alpha=0.01, N=1e4) #>     quantity  estimate     lower    upper #> 1  s2_repeat 0.6083333 0.1399813 22.01457 #> 2       s2_p 0.0000000        NA       NA #> 3       s2_o       NaN        NA       NA #> 4      s2_po       Inf        NA       NA #> 5     s2_tot       NaN        NA       NA #> 6   s2_repro       NaN        NA       NA #> 7   s2_gauge       NaN        NA       NA #> 8   pg_ratio       NaN        NA       NA #> 9   gt_ratio       NaN        NA       NA #> 10  pr_ratio 0.0000000        NA       NA

what: General Gauge R&R Analysis Function — gauge_rr
title: General Gauge R&R Analysis Function — gauge_rr
text: General Gauge R&R Analysis Function

title: General Gauge R&R Analysis Function — gauge_rr
code: gauge_rr(   data,   part = P,   operator = O,   measurement = Y,   interaction = FALSE,   factor1 = NULL,   factor2 = NULL,   formula = NULL )

title: General Gauge R&R Analysis Function — gauge_rr
text: data data frame contains measurements, operators parts Gauge R&R analysis part column data frame part labels measurements operator column data frame operator labels measurements measurement column data frame measurements object collected interaction binary parameter user can specify interaction data set. (using T/F TRUE/FALSE) factor1 tells function factor data set factor2 tells function multiple factors data set. formula user able input formula determines many factors model .

title: General Gauge R&R Analysis Function — gauge_rr
text: data frame confidence point estimator values, appropriate analysis (balanced/unbalanced, one factor/two factor, interaction/interaction)

title: General Gauge R&R Analysis Function — gauge_rr

text: data data frame contains measurements, operators parts Gauge R&R analysis part column data frame part labels measurements operator column data frame operator labels measurements measurement column data frame measurements object collected

text: data frame variance values names quantities associated values.

title: Variance Calculations for Gauge R&R data — gauge_variance
code: mydata <- data.frame(P=c(2,2,4,4,5,5),O=c(4,4,4,4,4,4),Y=c(5.3, 6.5, 5.4, 6.4, 6.9, 5.8)) gauge_variance(mydata) #>          quantity  variance #> 1   repeatability 0.6083333 #> 2 operators*parts       Inf #> 3           parts 0.0000000 #> 4       operators 0.0000000 #> 5             R&R        NA #> 6           total        NA

title: Percent of Variance Contribution — gauge_variance_per
code: mydata <- data.frame(p=c(1,1,2,2), o=c(1,2,1,2), m=c(2.3,4.5,3.4,4.3)) gauge_variance_per(mydata, part=p, operator=o, measurement=m) #>      per_rep per_po per_p per_o per_rr #> [1,]     NaN    NaN   NaN   NaN    NaN

title: Mean Sum of Squares — mean_ss
text: Mean Sum Squares

title: Mean Sum of Squares — mean_ss
code: mean_ss(data, part = P, operator = O, measurement = Y)

title: Mean Sum of Squares — mean_ss
text: data data frame contains measurements, operators parts Gauge R&R analysis part column data frame part labels measurements operator column data frame operator labels measurements measurement column data frame measurements object collected

title: Mean Sum of Squares — mean_ss
text: 4 mean sum square values MSE: considers part operator MSO: just considers operator MSP: just considers part MSPO: considers values part, operator part/operator interaction

title: Mean Sum of Squares — mean_ss
code: mydata <- data.frame(P=c(2,2,4,4,5,5),O=c(4,4,4,4,4,4),Y=c(5.3, 6.5, 5.4, 6.4, 6.9, 5.8)) mean_ss(mydata, part=P, operator=O, measurement = Y) #>         s_p s_o       s_e s_po #> [1,] 0.1125 NaN 0.6083333  Inf

title: Plotting Function — plot.intervals_table
text: Plotting Function

title: Plotting Function — plot.intervals_table
code: # S3 method for intervals_table plot(x, ...)

title: Plotting Function — plot.intervals_table
text: x data frame object class type "intervals_table" ... arguments can passed function

title: Plotting Function — plot.intervals_table
text: ggplot confidence intervals defined table.

title: Plotting Function — plot.intervals_table
code: mydf <- structure(data.frame(quantity = c("part", "operator"), estimate = c(12, 15), lower = c(3, 5), upper = c(20, 18)), class= c("intervals_table", "data.frame")) plot(mydf)

what: Point Estimates for Gauge R&R Analysis — point_estimate
title: Point Estimates for Gauge R&R Analysis — point_estimate
text: Point Estimates Gauge R&R Analysis

title: Point Estimates for Gauge R&R Analysis — point_estimate
code: point_estimate(data, part = P, operator = O, measurement = Y)

title: Point Estimates for Gauge R&R Analysis — point_estimate
text: data data frame consisting gauge R&R data run analysis part column data frame part labels measurements operator column data frame operator labels measurements measurement column data frame measurements object collected

title: Point Estimates for Gauge R&R Analysis — point_estimate
text: list point estimates s_p: point estimate parts s_o: point estimate operators s_po point estimate parts operators s_tot: total point estimate s_repro: point estimate reproducibility s_gauge: pg_ratio: part/gauge ratio (s2_p/s2_gauge) gt_ratio: gauge/total ratio (s2_gauge/s2_tot) pr_ratio: part/reproducibility ratio (s2_p/s2_repro)

title: Point Estimates for Gauge R&R Analysis — point_estimate
code: mydata <- data.frame(P=c(1,2), O=c(1,1), Y=c(5, 4)) point_estimate(mydata) #>      mu_y gamma_p gamma_m gamma_r #> [1,]  4.5    -Inf     NaN     NaN point_estimate(mydata, part=P, operator=O, measurement=Y) #>      mu_y gamma_p gamma_m gamma_r #> [1,]  4.5    -Inf     NaN     NaN

title: Unbalanced Two Factor Model — unbalanced_two_factor
code: mydata <- data.frame(P=c(1,1,2,2,3,3),O=c(1,2,1,2,1,2),Y=c(5.3, 6.5, 5.4, 6.4, 6.9, 5.8)) unbalanced_two_factor(mydata, alpha=0.01) #> Warning: NaNs produced #> Warning: NaNs produced #>   quantity estimate       lower      upper #> 1     part 36.77875 -1778.88366 5534.02811 #> 2    gauge      NaN         NaN        NaN #> 3       mu  6.05000   -37.01626   49.11626 #> 4  gamma_r      NaN         NaN        NaN
